verses.text_plain: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honour in abundance, and joined affinity with Ahab.
verses.verse_html: 1Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honour in abundance, and joined affinity with Ahab.

verses.text_plain: And after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance, and for the people that he had with him, and persuaded him to go up with him to Ramoth–gilead.
verses.verse_html:
2And after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance, and for the people that he had with him, and persuaded him to go up with him to Ramoth–gilead. ▼
▼ after…: Heb. at the end of years

footnotes.body_text: ▼ after…: Heb. at the end of years
footnotes.body_html: ▼ after…: Heb. at the end of years

verses.text_plain: And Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Wilt thou go with me to Ramoth–gilead? And he answered him, I am as thou art, and my people as thy people; and we will be with thee in the war.
verses.verse_html: 3And Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Wilt thou go with me to Ramoth–gilead? And he answered him, I am as thou art, and my people as thy people; and we will be with thee in the war.

verses.text_plain: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Lord to day.
verses.verse_html: 4And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Enquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Lord to day.

tokens.text: I pray thee, at the word

verses.text_plain: Therefore the king of Israel gathered together of prophets four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for God will deliver it into the king’s hand.
verses.verse_html: 5Therefore the king of Israel gathered together of prophets four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for God will deliver it into the king’s hand.

verses.text_plain: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the Lord besides, that we might enquire of him?
verses.verse_html:
6But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the Lord besides, that we might enquire of him? ▼
▼ besides: Heb. yet, or, more

footnotes.body_html: ▼ besides: Heb. yet, or, more

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, by whom we may enquire of the Lord: but I hate him; for he never prophesied good unto me, but always evil: the same is Micaiah the son of Imla. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
verses.verse_html: 7And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man, by whom we may enquire of the Lord: but I hate him; for he never prophesied good unto me, but always evil: the same is Micaiah the son of Imla. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel called for one of his officers, and said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imla.
verses.verse_html:
8And the king of Israel called for one of his officers, and said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imla. ▼
▼ officers: or, eunuchs
 , ▼
▼ Fetch…: Heb. Hasten

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah sat either of them on his throne, clothed in their robes, and they sat in a void place at the entering in of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them.
verses.verse_html:
9And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah sat either of them on his throne, clothed in their robes, and they sat in a void place at the entering in of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them. ▼
▼ void…: or, floor

verses.text_plain: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made him horns of iron, and said, Thus saith the Lord, With these thou shalt push Syria until they be consumed.
verses.verse_html:
10And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah had made him horns of iron, and said, Thus saith the Lord, With these thou shalt push Syria until they be consumed. ▼
▼ they…: Heb. thou consume them

footnotes.body_html: ▼ they…: Heb. thou consume them

verses.text_plain: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth–gilead, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it into the hand of the king.
verses.verse_html: 11And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth–gilead, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it into the hand of the king.

verses.text_plain: And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one assent; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.
verses.verse_html:
12And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one assent; let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good. ▼
▼ with…: Heb. with one mouth

tokens.text: therefore, I pray thee, be like one

footnotes.body_html: ▼ with…: Heb. with one mouth

verses.text_plain: And Micaiah said, As the Lord liveth, even what my God saith, that will I speak.
verses.verse_html: 13And Micaiah said, As the Lord liveth, even what my God saith, that will I speak.

verses.text_plain: And when he was come to the king, the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And he said, Go ye up, and prosper, and they shall be delivered into your hand.
verses.verse_html: 14And when he was come to the king, the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth–gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And he said, Go ye up, and prosper, and they shall be delivered into your hand.

verses.text_plain: And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou say nothing but the truth to me in the name of the Lord?
verses.verse_html: 15And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou say nothing but the truth to me in the name of the Lord?

verses.text_plain: Then he said, I did see all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and the Lord said, These have no master; let them return therefore every man to his house in peace.
verses.verse_html: 16Then he said, I did see all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and the Lord said, These have no master; let them return therefore every man to his house in peace.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good unto me, but evil?
verses.verse_html:
17And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good unto me, but evil? ▼
▼ but evil: or, but for evil

footnotes.body_text: ▼ but evil: or, but for evil
footnotes.body_html: ▼ but evil: or, but for evil

verses.text_plain: Again he said, Therefore hear the word of the Lord; I saw the Lord sitting upon his throne, and all the host of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.
verses.verse_html: 18Again he said, Therefore hear the word of the Lord; I saw the Lord sitting upon his throne, and all the host of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth–gilead? And one spake saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner.
verses.verse_html: 19And the Lord said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth–gilead? And one spake saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner.

verses.text_plain: Then there came out a spirit, and stood before the Lord, and said, I will entice him. And the Lord said unto him, Wherewith?
verses.verse_html: 20Then there came out a spirit, and stood before the Lord, and said, I will entice him. And the Lord said unto him, Wherewith?

verses.text_plain: And he said, I will go out, and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And the Lord said, Thou shalt entice him, and thou shalt also prevail: go out, and do even so.
verses.verse_html: 21And he said, I will go out, and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And the Lord said, Thou shalt entice him, and thou shalt also prevail: go out, and do even so.

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, behold, the Lord hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets, and the Lord hath spoken evil against thee.
verses.verse_html: 22Now therefore, behold, the Lord hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets, and the Lord hath spoken evil against thee.

verses.text_plain: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah upon the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the Lord from me to speak unto thee?
verses.verse_html: 23Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah upon the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the Lord from me to speak unto thee?

verses.text_plain: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
verses.verse_html:
24And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself. ▼
▼ into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber

footnotes.body_text: ▼ into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber
footnotes.body_html: ▼ into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber

verses.text_plain: Then the king of Israel said, Take ye Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
verses.verse_html: 25Then the king of Israel said, Take ye Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;

verses.text_plain: And say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.
verses.verse_html: 26And say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.

verses.text_plain: And Micaiah said, If thou certainly return in peace, then hath not the Lord spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, all ye people.
verses.verse_html: 27And Micaiah said, If thou certainly return in peace, then hath not the Lord spoken by me. And he said, Hearken, all ye people.

verses.text_plain: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth–gilead.
verses.verse_html: 28So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth–gilead.

verses.text_plain: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and will go to the battle; but put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went to the battle.
verses.verse_html: 29And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and will go to the battle; but put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went to the battle.

verses.text_plain: Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of the chariots that were with him, saying, Fight ye not with small or great, save only with the king of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 30Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of the chariots that were with him, saying, Fight ye not with small or great, save only with the king of Israel.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they compassed about him to fight: but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the Lord helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.
verses.verse_html: 31And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they compassed about him to fight: but Jehoshaphat cried out, and the Lord helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when the captains

verses.text_plain: For it came to pass, that, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back again from pursuing him.
verses.verse_html:
32For it came to pass, that, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it was not the king of Israel, they turned back again from pursuing him. ▼
▼ from…: Heb. from after him

tokens.text: For it came to pass, that, when the captains
that it was not the king

footnotes.body_html: ▼ from…: Heb. from after him

verses.text_plain: And a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: therefore he said to his chariot man, Turn thine hand, that thou mayest carry me out of the host; for I am wounded.
verses.verse_html:
33And a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness: therefore he said to his chariot man, Turn thine hand, that thou mayest carry me out of the host; for I am wounded. ▼
▼ at a venture: Heb. in his simplicity
 , ▼
▼ between…: Heb. between the joints and between the breastplate
 , ▼
▼ wounded: Heb. made sick

tokens.text: that thou mayest carry me out

footnotes.body_text: ▼ at a venture: Heb. in his simplicity
footnotes.body_html: ▼ at a venture: Heb. in his simplicity

footnotes.body_text: ▼ between…: Heb. between the joints and between the breastplate
footnotes.body_html: ▼ between…: Heb. between the joints and between the breastplate
▼ wounded: Heb. made sick

verses.text_plain: And the battle increased that day: howbeit the king of Israel stayed himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the even: and about the time of the sun going down he died.
verses.verse_html: 34And the battle increased that day: howbeit the king of Israel stayed himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the even: and about the time of the sun going down he died.
